question: If <katex>$v_p, L_p, r_p$</katex> and <katex>$v_a, L_a, r_a$</katex> are radii, velocities and angular momenta of a planet at perihelion and aphelion of its elliptical orbit around the Sun respectively, then
explanation: Perihelion is the closest point, so <katex>$r_p < r_a$</katex>.
Angular momentum is conserved, so <katex>$L_p = L_a$</katex>.
Since <katex>$L = mvr$</katex>, and <katex>$r$</katex> is smaller at perihelion, <katex>$v$</katex> must be larger: <katex>$v_p > v_a$</katex>.
